data.title: Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen - R.I.P.
data.meta_description: Some very sad news for jazz fans. Bassist extraordinaire Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen died Wednesday night at the age of 58. This guy was one of my...
data.text:
Some very sad news for jazz fans. Bassist extraordinaire Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen died Wednesday night at the age of 58. This guy was one of my all-time favorite acoustic bass players, and he was a perfect fit with the Oscar Peterson Trio. From the Jazz Times site:

Danish Bassist Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen Dies

Danish bassist Niels-Henning Orsted Pedersen died Wednesday night at age 58.

The bassist had been playing professionally since he was 14 and Count Basie offered 17-year-old Pedersen a spot in his orchestra, which Pedersen had to turn down. Instead, he worked regularly as the house bassist at the Club Montmarte and was a member of the Danish Radio Orchestra.

Musicians regularly asked for Pedersen when they passed through Denmark on international tours and, as a result, Pedersen has performed with artists including Sonny Rollins, Bill Evans, Roland Kirk, Dexter Gordon, Bud Powell and Albert Ayler. Pedersen was also a member of the Oscar Peterson Trio and recorded for SteepleChase and Pablo Records.

No further details surrounding Pedersenâ€™s death were available.

Capt. Bacardi
